content: Fe­(BF4)2·6H2O (450 mg, 1.2 mmol), chloranilic acid (250 mg, 1.2 mmol) and NMe4BF4 (390 mg, 2.4 mmol) were mixed in DMF (80 mL) to give a purple suspension. The mixture was then heated at 130 °C for 2 days to afford shiny black, hexagonal plate-shaped crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis, in addition to flocculent powders. The mixture was allowed to cool to ambient temperature and followed by vortex shaking for 5 min. The powder was removed from the remaining solid mixture by successive washing with DMF and subsequent decanting (5 × 15 mL). The remaining black crystalline solid was filtered and dried under vacuum to yield 2 (75 mg, 13.6%). Anal. calcd. for C47H73Fe2N9O19Cl6: C, 40.49; H, 5.24; N, 9.05%. Found: C, 40.45; H, 5.27; N, 8.74%.
clean_text:
Synthesis of (NMe4)2[Fe2L3]⋅7DMF (2)

Fe(BF4)2⋅6H2O (450 mg, 1.2 mmol), chloranilic acid (250 mg, 1.2 mmol) and NMe4BF4 (390 mg, 2.4 mmol) were mixed in DMF (80 mL) to give a purple suspension. The mixture was then heated at 130 °C for 2 days to afford shiny black, hexagonal plate-shaped crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis, in addition to flocculent powders. The mixture was allowed to cool to ambient temperature and followed by vortex shaking for 5 min. The powder was removed from the remaining solid mixture by successive washing with DMF and subsequent decanting (5 × 15 mL). The remaining black crystalline solid was filtered and dried under vacuum to yield 2 (75 mg, 13.6%). Anal. calcd. for C47H73Fe2N9O19Cl6: C, 40.49; H, 5.24; N, 9.05%. Found: C, 40.45; H, 5.27; N, 8.74%.
